questions.question: What turns you on the most in a partner?

answers.text: Deep eye contact and emotional connection.
Exploring fantasies and trying new things.

questions.question: How do you like to set the mood?

answers.text: A sensual massage and physical closeness.
Lighting candles and playing soft music.
Whispering fantasies and teasing the possibilities.

questions.question: Which scenario excites you the most?

answers.text: Pouring your heart out and feeling truly seen.
A steamy night of passionate physical connection.
A surprise getaway to a romantic destination.
An adventurous date that pushes boundaries.
Experimenting with fantasies you’ve never tried before.

questions.question: How do you keep the spark alive in a long-term relationship?

answers.text: Planning romantic surprises and date nights.
Trying new activities and pushing limits together.
Exploring new fantasies and staying curious.

questions.question: What’s your ideal way to explore intimacy with your partner?

answers.text: Sharing secrets and building emotional closeness.
Discovering each other’s bodies through touch.
Crafting a magical romantic evening together.
Taking risks and trying something completely new.
Diving into shared fantasies and desires.

Emotional Intimacy.description: You crave deep emotional connections as the foundation of your intimacy. Feeling truly seen and understood excites you more than anything else.
Emotional Intimacy.idealPartnerTraits: Empathetic, emotionally available, and willing to communicate openly.
suggestionsForPartner: Share your deepest thoughts and listen with full attention.
Be vulnerable and express your emotions freely.
Create moments to connect emotionally before anything physical.
recommendations: Read books about emotional intelligence and connection.
Try couples’ exercises that enhance emotional awareness.
Practice gratitude journaling together to deepen your bond.

Physical Intimacy.description: You thrive on physical closeness and passionate touch to feel fully connected. Sensuality is your love language, and you’re not afraid to show it.
Physical Intimacy.idealPartnerTraits: Affectionate, attentive to physical needs, and confident in expressing desire.
suggestionsForPartner: Initiate daily physical gestures, like hugs or kisses.
Plan sensual activities, such as a shared bubble bath or massage.
Be attentive and responsive to your partner’s physical cues.
recommendations: Explore books or guides on enhancing physical intimacy.
Learn massage techniques to spice up physical touch.
Experiment with activities that encourage closeness, like yoga or dance.

Romantic Intimacy.description: You’re a hopeless romantic who values grand gestures and magical moments. Your ideal intimacy is filled with thoughtfulness and meaningful surprises.
Romantic Intimacy.idealPartnerTraits: Thoughtful, creative, and enjoys planning special experiences.
suggestionsForPartner: Plan surprise dates or romantic evenings.
Show love through small but meaningful gestures, like flowers or love notes.
Create a playlist or ambiance to set the mood for intimacy.
recommendations: Explore books about romantic connection and love languages.
Try creative date ideas, like painting nights or scenic picnics.
Use apps that help you plan romantic getaways or surprises.

Adventurous Intimacy.description: You thrive on excitement and spontaneity in your intimate life. New experiences and bold moves keep your passion alive.
Adventurous Intimacy.idealPartnerTraits: Adventurous, playful, and willing to try new things.
suggestionsForPartner: Plan spontaneous adventures, like road trips or surprise outings.
Take risks in the bedroom and explore new scenarios together.
Encourage each other to try activities outside your comfort zones.
recommendations: Explore adventure-focused workshops or classes.
Try apps that suggest unique date ideas or activities.
Watch shows or read about adventurous couples for inspiration.

Sexual Exploration.description: You’re curious and eager to explore new fantasies and desires with your partner. Communication and experimentation are your keys to satisfaction.
Sexual Exploration.idealPartnerTraits: Open-minded, confident, and eager to explore shared desires.
suggestionsForPartner: Discuss fantasies and desires openly and without judgment.
Experiment with new ideas in a safe and consensual way.
Focus on mutual pleasure and shared exploration.
recommendations: Read books or guides on sexual exploration and communication.
Try apps or tools designed to spark intimate conversations.
Explore mindfulness techniques to enhance intimacy.

questions.question: I feel most loved when my partner...
When I want to show love, I usually...

answers.text: Write a heartfelt note or text.
Take care of something for them.

questions.question: Which of these makes you feel most connected?

answers.text: Physical closeness like hugs or kisses.

questions.question: What do you appreciate most from your partner?
What makes you feel most appreciated?

Words of Affirmation.description: You feel loved through kind words and compliments.
Words of Affirmation.idealPartnerTraits: Someone who is expressive and values verbal communication.
suggestionsForPartner: Offer daily compliments to build confidence and connection.
Write heartfelt notes or messages to express appreciation.
Verbally acknowledge achievements and efforts.
recommendations: Read books about verbal communication, such as 'The Five Love Languages'.
Practice gratitude journaling to improve positive affirmations.
Explore apps or tools for sharing daily positive affirmations.

Quality Time.description: You value undivided attention and meaningful time spent together.
Quality Time.idealPartnerTraits: Someone who prioritizes shared experiences and active listening.
suggestionsForPartner: Schedule weekly date nights with no distractions.
Plan activities or trips to create lasting memories.
Practice being fully present during conversations.
recommendations: Try couple-oriented activities, like cooking classes or hiking.
Use apps that encourage shared goals or experiences (e.g., adventure planners).
Read books about creating meaningful connections.

Receiving Gifts.description: Thoughtful presents and tokens of love are most meaningful to you.
Receiving Gifts.idealPartnerTraits: Someone who enjoys thoughtful gestures and remembers special occasions.
suggestionsForPartner: Focus on meaningful rather than expensive gifts.
Surprise your partner with small tokens that reflect their interests.
Pay attention to hints about items they like or need.
recommendations: Explore curated gift lists for inspiration.
Keep a shared wishlist to ensure gifts are meaningful.
Look into creative or DIY gift ideas for a personal touch.

Acts of Service.description: You feel most loved when your partner helps you or takes care of tasks.
Acts of Service.idealPartnerTraits: Someone who is attentive and proactive in offering support.
suggestionsForPartner: Help with daily tasks like cooking, cleaning, or errands.
Take initiative in planning or organizing shared responsibilities.
Surprise your partner by completing tasks they dislike.
recommendations: Use tools like 'Trello' or 'Todoist' to coordinate tasks efficiently.
Learn about the importance of shared responsibilities in relationships.
Read blogs or watch videos on acts of service in partnerships.

Physical Touch.description: Physical closeness, like hugs and cuddles, is your love language.
Physical Touch.idealPartnerTraits: Someone who values touch as a form of comfort and connection.
suggestionsForPartner: Give hugs, hold hands, or cuddle during quiet moments.
Be attentive to their comfort level with physical affection.
Offer massages or other forms of relaxing touch.
recommendations: Explore activities that involve physical closeness, like dancing or yoga.
Learn about the benefits of physical affection for emotional well-being.
Read relationship guides focused on touch-based connections.

questions.question: How often do you share your feelings with your partner?
Do you feel safe discussing difficult topics with your partner?
How often do you feel understood by your partner?
When was the last time you had a deep, meaningful conversation with your partner?
How comfortable are you being vulnerable with your partner?

High Intimacy.description: You and your partner share a deep emotional connection.
suggestionsForPartner: Have meaningful conversations regularly.
Be honest about your feelings and encourage vulnerability.
Celebrate emotional milestones together.
recommendations: Explore 'Nonviolent Communication' for deeper connection.
Practice mindfulness to enhance emotional presence.
Read books about emotional intelligence.

Moderate Intimacy.description: You share feelings but could improve in understanding and trust.
Moderate Intimacy.idealPartnerTraits: Patient, supportive, and willing to grow.
suggestionsForPartner: Create a safe space for discussing difficult topics.
Spend time learning about each other’s emotional needs.
Work on active listening skills to build understanding.
recommendations: Try journaling to express and share feelings.
Explore couples therapy to strengthen connection.
Join relationship workshops for emotional intimacy.

Low Intimacy.description: You might find it challenging to share your feelings or feel understood. Building trust and communication could greatly improve your relationship.
Low Intimacy.idealPartnerTraits: Supportive, understanding, and willing to help create a safe space for growth.
suggestionsForPartner: Encourage open communication in a judgment-free environment.
Take small steps to build trust and emotional safety.
Focus on being patient and empathetic during difficult conversations.
recommendations: Read books or articles on building trust in relationships.
Consider individual or couple’s therapy to address deeper issues.
Practice daily habits like expressing gratitude to strengthen emotional bonds.
